title: How to Block NO-SENDER emails
content: I keep getting emails that say NO-SENDER instead of having a real email address and i have no way to block them and junk mail setting doesnt keep them in the junk folder either. Thanks Megarock
creator: Megarock

title: Cannot Manage Messages
content: This is a Mac Monterey 12.6.9 with Thunderbird 102.15.1. I want my messages in chronological order, earliest on top, latest on bottom with no topical subdivisions. The dates keep skipping around. I do not remember arranging the date order of these messages being so difficult. What is the secret?
creator: tightpurchaser

title: Using Fastmail - Sent Folder is called Sent on win but "sent items" on Mac
content:
I use Fastmail In Fastmail's web app, the sent mail accumulates in a folder called "Sent" On Windows TB is configured to save sent messages in Fastmail's Sent folder. On Mac, if TB is configured to save messages in "Sent" they go into a folder called "Sent" but that folder does not have the same contents as the "Sent" folder in Fastmail's web app.

In fact. on the Mac I must configure TB to save in a folder called "Sent Items". If I do that then the messages also appear in the Sent folder on tb-Windows and on the Fastmail web app.

I find this very confusing. Perhaps someone can explain the discrepency

Thank you
creator: essin
